Activity: Log in to the system, check emails and company announcements. Briefly review the weekly goals: project setup, player character, game loop, collision detection, player movement, input handling, camera controls, and basic collision prevention. Mentally prioritize tasks - project setup and version control are critical first steps.

Create a new project in the designated game engine (Unreal Engine). Set up the basic folder structure: Source, Content, Config. Commit the initial, empty project to the company's Git repository. Configure .gitignore to exclude intermediate files and build artifacts.

Configure version control settings. Set up the project's Git repository. Ensure proper branching strategy is in place (develop, main). Create a new branch 'feature/player_character' for player-related development.
Begin creating the Player Character class. Define the base class 'AGameCharacter' in C++. Add basic properties: health, speed, isAlive. Implement getter and setter functions for these properties.
Implement basic player movement functions: MoveForward(), MoveRight(), Jump(). These functions will be the basis for input handling later. Leave them empty for now.
Investigate the engine's built-in Input System. Explore Input Mapping Contexts and Action/Axis Mappings. Consult the engine documentation and online resources for best practices.
Create a new Input Mapping Context named 'PlayerInputContext'. Define Action Mappings for 'MoveForward', 'MoveRight', 'Jump'.
Bind keyboard inputs (W, A, S, D, Spacebar) to the corresponding Action Mappings in 'PlayerInputContext'.
Integrate the Input System into the 'AGameCharacter' class. Implement event handling for the 'MoveForward', 'MoveRight', 'Jump' actions. Call the corresponding movement functions.
Test the initial input integration. Verify that pressing the assigned keys triggers the corresponding events in the Player Character class.
Commit changes to the 'feature/player_character' branch with a descriptive message: 'Initial player character class and input system integration.'
